questions.question: Calculate the orbital period of a satellite $10,000 \text{ km}$ from the center of a planet with mass $5 \times 10^{24} \text{ kg}$. (Use $T = 2\pi\sqrt{r^3/GM}$, $G = 6.67 \times 10^{-11}$)
If a planet's mass is doubled and the orbital radius is also doubled, the orbital speed will:
If Planet X is $3 \text{ AU}$ from the Sun and Planet Y is $9 \text{ AU}$ from the Sun, how do their orbital periods compare?
options: Planet Y's period is 3 times longer.
Planet Y's period is 9 times longer.
Planet Y's period is $\sqrt{27}$ times longer.
Planet Y's period is 27 times longer.

questions.question: A planet takes 64 years to orbit the Sun. What is its average distance (semi-major axis) from the Sun? (Earth: $T=1$ year, $r=1$ AU)
A hypothetical planet has an orbital period of 1 year, but its orbit is highly elliptical. Its average distance from the Sun must be:
questions.explanation: Kepler's Third Law relates period to semi-major axis. $T=1$ year ⇒ $a=1$ AU regardless of eccentricity.

questions.question: What is an 'Astronomical Unit' (AU)?
options: The distance light travels in one year.
The average distance between the Earth and the Sun.
The circumference of the Earth's orbit.
questions.explanation: 1 AU ≈ $1.5 \times 10^{11}$ m, the average Earth-Sun distance.

questions.question: Where is the Sun located in a planetary orbit?
options: At the geometric center of the ellipse.
At one focus, while the other focus is empty.
On the perimeter of the ellipse.
questions.explanation: Kepler's First Law: planets orbit in ellipses with Sun at one focus.

questions.question: Which term describes the point in a planet's orbit where it is closest to the Sun?
questions.explanation: Perihelion = closest to Sun; Aphelion = farthest from Sun.

questions.question: A person is standing on a scale in an elevator. The scale reading represents the person's:
questions.explanation: Scale measures normal force, which equals apparent weight.

questions.question: If you are in an elevator that is accelerating upward, your apparent weight will be:
questions.explanation: $F_N - mg = ma$ ⇒ $F_N = mg + ma > mg$, so apparent weight increases.
